lines.content: This is a greenfield Java project. It's named after the goddess of the night, _nyx_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/nyx.Nyx.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run nyx.Nyx.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* The main class for the Nyx chatbot application.
* It initializes the necessary components and runs the main loop to process user commands.
* Initializes the storage, UI, and task list components.
* Runs the main loop of the Nyx chatbot.
* Displays the welcome message and processes user commands until the "bye" command is received.
* The main method to start the Nyx chatbot application.
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing user input and returning the appropriate command.
* Enum representing the different types of commands.
* Parses the user input and returns the corresponding command.
* @return The command corresponding to the user input.
* The Storage class handles loading and saving task data to and from a file.
private static final Path FILE_PATH = Paths.get("data", "tasks.txt");
* Loads task data from the file.
* If the file or directories do not exist, they are created.
* @return An ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file.
// Create the file if it doesn't exist
return tasks; // No data to load yet
// Define the formatter for the expected date format
EventTask eventTask = new EventTask(taskName, startTime, endTime);
* Saves task data to the file.
* If the directory and necessary file do not exist, they are created.
* @param toSave The string representation of the tasks to save.
* Helper method to normalize the date string.
* Ensures the day part of the date is always two digits.
* @param dateString The date string to normalize.
parts[1] = "0" + parts[1]; // Add leading zero to day part
* The TaskList class manages a list of tasks.
* It provides methods to add, delete, and mark tasks as complete or incomplete.
* Constructs a new TaskList instance with the specified list of tasks.
* @param tasks The initial list of tasks.
* Returns a string representation of the current list of tasks.
* @return A string representing the current list of tasks.
sb.append("Here is the current list of tasks:\n");
* Returns a string representation of the tasks in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the tasks in a save format.
* Adds a task to the task list and displays a message using the specified UI.
* @param ui   The UI to use for displaying messages.
public void addTask(Task task, Ui ui) {
String output = "Task created: " + task + "\n" + "There are currently " + tasks.size() + " tasks.";
* Deletes a task from the task list at the specified index and displays a message using the specified UI.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to delete.
* @param ui        The UI to use for displaying messages.
public void deleteTask(int taskIndex, Ui ui) {
String output = "Task deleted: " + taskToDelete + "\n" + "There are currently " + tasks.size() + " tasks.";
* Marks a task as complete at the specified index and displays a message using the specified UI.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to mark as complete.
* @param ui        The UI to use for displaying messages.
public void markTaskAsComplete(int taskIndex, Ui ui) {
String output = "Task marked as complete: " + tasks.get(taskIndex) + "\n";
* Marks a task as incomplete at the specified index and displays a message using the specified UI.
* @param taskIndex The index of the task to mark as incomplete.
* @param ui        The UI to use for displaying messages.
public void markTaskAsIncomplete(int taskIndex, Ui ui) {

* The Ui class handles all interactions with the user.
* It displays messages, reads user input, and manages the user interface.
private static final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message, including the logo and a divider.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?\n" + divider);
* Reads a command from the user input.
* @return The command entered by the user.
* Closes the scanner to clean up resources.
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* Executes the ByeCommand, displaying a goodbye message.
* @throws NyxException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {
* All specific command types should extend this class.
* @throws NyxException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException;
* Represents a command to add a deadline task.
* Constructs a new DeadlineCommand instance with the specified input command.
* Executes the DeadlineCommand, adding a deadline task to the task list.
* @throws NyxException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {
throw new InvalidUsageException("Wrong Usage. Correct usage: deadline [task name] -by [deadline]\n"
+ "Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format. For example: 2025-02-19");
* Parses the input command to create a DeadlineTask.
* Represents a command to delete a task.
* Constructs a new DeleteCommand instance with the specified input command.
* Executes the DeleteCommand, deleting a task from the task list.
* @throws NyxException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {
throw new InvalidUsageException("Wrong usage. Correct usage: delete [task id]");
* Represents a command to add an event task.
* Constructs a new EventCommand instance with the specified input command.
* Executes the EventCommand, adding an event task to the task list.
* @throws NyxException If an error occurs during execution.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {
throw new InvalidUsageException("Wrong usage. Correct usage: event [event name] -start [time] -end [time]\n"
+ "Dates should be in YYYY-MM-DD format. For example: 2025-02-19");

* The search query is extracted from the user input.

* Executes the ListCommand, displaying the current list of tasks.

public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {

public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {

* Represents a command that is not recognized.
* Executes the UnknownCommand, throwing an UnknownCommandException.
* @throws NyxException Always thrown to indicate an unrecognized command.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {

public void execute(TaskList taskList, Storage storage, Ui ui) throws NyxException {

* Represents an exception that is thrown when a command is used incorrectly.
* Constructs a new InvalidUsageException with the specified detail message.
* Represents a generic exception in the Nyx application.
* Constructs a new NyxException with the specified detail message.
* Represents an exception that is thrown when an unknown command is encountered.
* Constructs a new UnknownCommandException with the specified detail message.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Constructs a new DeadlineTask instance with the specified name and deadline.
* @param name     The name of the task.
* @param deadline The deadline of the task.
* Returns the task type as a string.
* @return The task type, which is "D" for DeadlineTask.
* Returns a string representation of the task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the task in a save format.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* Represents a task that is an event with a start and end date.
* Constructs a new EventTask instance with the specified name, start date, and end date.
* @param name  The name of the event.
* @param start The start date of the event.
* @param end   The end date of the event.
public EventTask(String name, LocalDate start, LocalDate end) {
* Returns the task type as a string.

* The Task class represents a generic task.
* It provides methods to mark the task as complete or incomplete, and to get the task's details.

* @param name The name of the task.
* Returns the task type as a string.
* Returns the completed status of the task.
* @return 1 if the task is completed, 0 otherwise.
* Returns the name of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task in a format suitable for saving to a file.
* @return A string representing the task in a save format.
* Returns a string representation of the task.

* @param name The name of the task.
* Returns the task type as a string.
* @return The task type, which is "T" for TodoTask.
* Returns a string representation of the task.
